intro: Hedyotis subulata, commonly known as the needleleaf geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, needle-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in mountainous regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Hedyotis subulata is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
